timeline.message: Change how protected/registration guard is used

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't signInGuard not be necessary on this line, since it's nested under the other protected routes component?
timeline.author: calbach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -98,14 +98,15 @@ export const AppRoutingComponent: React.FunctionComponent<RoutingProps> = ({onSi
           }} />}
       />
       <AppRoute path='/nih-callback' component={() => <HomepagePage routeData={{title: 'Homepage'}}/>} />
-    </ProtectedRoutes>
 
-    <ProtectedRoutes guards={[signInGuard, registrationGuard]}>
-      <AppRoute
+      <ProtectedRoutes guards={[signInGuard, registrationGuard]}>

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand the bug with the previous approach, could you summarize the issue? Is it only possible to have one to-level ProtectedRoutes component? Probably a comment here would be useful to prevent a recurrence of this.
timeline.author: calbach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -98,14 +98,15 @@ export const AppRoutingComponent: React.FunctionComponent<RoutingProps> = ({onSi
           }} />}
       />
       <AppRoute path='/nih-callback' component={() => <HomepagePage routeData={{title: 'Homepage'}}/>} />
-    </ProtectedRoutes>
 
-    <ProtectedRoutes guards={[signInGuard, registrationGuard]}>
-      <AppRoute
+      <ProtectedRoutes guards={[signInGuard, registrationGuard]}>
+        <AppRoute
           path='/library'
           component={() => <WorkspaceLibraryPage routeData={{title: 'Workspace Library', minimizeChrome: false}}/>}
-      />
+        />
+      </ProtectedRoutes>

timeline.message: Further detail in the bug comment
